page.title: 09BOTHWELL CASTLE
page.content: {Bothwell Castle }is situated approximately 3/4 of a mile from Uddingston Cross. Access is possible by road although the last 300 yards must be taken on foot. The building of the castle began towards the end of the 13th Century, and its position made it extremely significant in the Wars of Independence (1296 - 1328) being taken repeatedly by both sides and eventually being surrendered to the Scots after{Bannockburn,}who dismantled it. Since that time building work has taken place three times. At present the castle is owned by Douglas Hume, but has been under Government care since 1935. The castle has approximately 4500-5000 visitors per year including many school parties. Restoration work is taking place at present and is hoped to be completed in 2 years.
